Detailed Description

Represents the listbox where TwitterStatus items are displayed of a specific TwitterFeed object (one at a time).

The feed can be changed with SetFeed, which registers with the feed for updates (using the observer pattern).

See also:
SetFeed

TwitterUpdateListener

Member Enumeration Documentation

void FeedPanel::CopyItemAsHtml ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Activated when user clicks the Copy as HTML popup menu item.

Copies status text to clipboard as it is seen in the list box (HTML decorated).

Precondition:
clipboard is accessible
Postcondition:
status text (as HTML) is added to clipboard contents

Here is the call graph for this function:

wxString FeedPanel::DecorateSource ( wxString  text  )  const [protected]

Decorates the Twitter source text.

Used to change the link colour since the source already has an HTML link tag in it.

Parameters:
text the source text to decorate
Returns:
the source text decorated with HTML (link colours changed)

wxString FeedPanel::DecorateStatusText ( wxString  text  )  const [protected]

Decorates the Twitter status text with HTML, linking all URLs and reply or hashtag words.

Parameters:
text the status text to decorate
Returns:
a decorated version (in HTML) of a Twitter status text.

Overrides the basic selected list item text colour.

currently returns wxBLACK

const TwitterStatus FeedPanel::GetStatusItem ( unsigned int  n  )  const [protected]

Gets a status item at index n of the filtered results.

Warning:
Use this instead of accessing the feed directly.
Returns:
the nth TwitterStatus item after filtering the feed results
See also:
FilteredIterator

Here is the call graph for this function:

unsigned int FeedPanel::GetStatusSize (  )  const [protected]

Gets the size of the feed with filtering applied using the FilteredIterator.

This is used when you only want to show "@reply" tweets, for instance (filter is set to FilteredIterator::FILTER_REPLIES).

Warning:
Use this function instead of getting the feed size directly, as they may not match.
Returns:
the size of the feed with filters applied
See also:
AddFilter

FilteredIterator

Here is the call graph for this function:

wxString FeedPanel::OnGetItem ( size_t  n  )  const

Overrides the wxHtmlListBox functionality to retrieve the list item at index n.

Should return an HTML string representing the list item.

Returns:
the HTML string contents of the item

void FeedPanel::SetFeed ( const wxString &  resource,
int  delay = Twitter::DefaultFeedDelay 
)

Sets the feed to follow by a resource name (see Twitter constants).

This method will try to load the feed object from disk (via Twitter::LoadFeed) if one exists.

Parameters:
resource the feed resource name to follow
delay delay between feed updates

Here is the call graph for this function:

void FeedPanel::StatusNotification ( const TwitterStatus &  status  )  [protected]

Creates a tray notification (MainWindow::TrayNotification) with the proper information from a TwitterStatus.

Postcondition:
a tray notification should be displayed
Parameters:
status the TwitterStatus object to show a tray notification for
See also:
MainWindow::TrayNotification

Here is the call graph for this function:

void FeedPanel::TwitterUpdateReceived ( const Twitter &  twitter,
const wxString &  resource 
) [virtual]

Implements the TwitterUpdateListener observer interface and handles a status update when registered with a specific feed.

Warning:
this call will likely come from another thread and should not try to directly access the wx UI controls (not thread-safe) and should post an event instead.
Precondition:
resource == feedResource && twitter == Application::GetTwitter()
Postcondition:
refreshes the listbox contents

Implements TwitterUpdateListener.

Here is the call graph for this function:
